results.title: [Remix: Women in science and technology]
results.brief_description:
This remix is a short film celebrating women in professional roles, including science, technology, aviation, mechanics and farming, sourced from footage in the ACMI Collection.

ACMI gratefully acknowledges the following donors and creators in the compilation of this work: Dried Fruits Australia, Cargill Australia, Australian Wool Innovation Ltd., Rio Tinto, Elenor Peach, Yolanta Simmonds, Dept. of Employment, John Richardson, Wine Australia and Ivan Gaal.

holdings.name: MPEG-4 Digital File; ACMI External Digital Access Copy

results.title: [Nixon Family Home Movie Collection]
results.brief_description:
The Nixon Family Home Movie Collection tells the story of a suburban family in 1960s–1980s Geelong, Victoria, with Mum (Dorothy) and Dad (Les) and the two kids, Karen and Stuart. Les and Dorothy lived at Herne Hill, Geelong, where the films show the two children growing up. Particularly Karen, from when she was a newborn baby up to her 21st birthday and first car.

Captured over ten movies, initially on Standard 8mm and then Super 8mm film, most of the footage was taken by Les but occasionally when he appears on screen, we know Dorothy was behind the camera.

Through these family films we see the children grow up, the fun of beach holidays, fancy hats worn at family weddings, games played at birthdays and special holiday destinations. Some of the loveliest footage shows the simple pastimes of children: ‘dinking’ your baby brother around in the back of the tricycle at home, burying yourself up to the waist in the sand at the beach and jumping over a sprinkler on a hot day in the backyard by the ‘Hills Hoist’.

The large extended family also feature in the films and they would often holiday at their cousin’s beach house at 8th Avenue, Point Roadknight, on the Surf Coast of Victoria. In 1966, the family also spent some time in the sandy yard of a home in Alice Springs, from where they visit Amoonguna, an indigenous community 15kms southwest of Alice.

Visits from “Nana and Pop”, playing tennis, visiting a farm and family picnics also feature. Forget ‘lifestyles of the rich and famous’, this family collection spanning over twenty one years is far more enlightening and endearing.

This collection of home movies was donated to ACMI by Karen Corry.

results.title: [Queen who returned Compilation]
results.creator_credit: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria
results.brief_description: Features three films of Royal visits between 1954 and 1963. 1.”Royal Visit to Melbourne” - Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth and His Royal Highness the Duke of Edinburgh. 2.”Queen who Returned” - Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, visits Victoria. 3.”Royal Visit” - Queen Elizabeth and the Duke on tour in Victoria.
results.creator_credit_for_label: H. Rodney Power, David Swift and State Film Centre of Victoria

results.title: [Nicoll Family Home Movie Collection]
results.brief_description:
The Nicoll Family Home Movie Collection is a collection of 16mm home movies made by Alexander (Alex) Nicoll from the 1930s to the 1960s. The films were donated to ACMI by the filmmaker’s son Mac Nicoll.

Alex was gifted his camera from a wealthy mentor, Arthur Thomas, who also lent Alex money to establish a business. Alex began a lifelong involvement in the “rag trade”, running an import agency on the third floor at Tasmania House. He was a popular figure in “The Lane”, serving for some years as the President of the Victorian Softgoods Association.

Alex always deeply respected Arthur Thomas, keeping a framed photo of Thomas on his desk until he retired. Thomas was a keen photographer and when he died in the 1930s he left Alex his Agfa 16mm camera, his projector and collapsible screen, all of which Alex frequently used during the 1940s and 1950s. There were films galore: films of family at home and on holidays, of faraway places in his later years and local events. For example, he captured the excitement of the 1956 Olympics in Melbourne with footage of the decorated buildings in the city with the department stores of the era – Foy’s, Buckley’s, Myer, Coles and Woolworths. He was often asked to show his films at family events and other local gatherings.

Alex suffered a serious stroke in 1960, which caused the sale of his business and the end of his photography. He died in 1968 and the film equipment passed to his son, Mac, who continued filming the comings and goings of his young family in the 1960s to the early 1970s. Mac valued the support shown to his father and in his way, supported others by becoming a well-respected teacher.

results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

results.title: [Noise] = Hearing conservation
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield, Dept of Science and Technology and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Serious hearing loss perpetrated in the industrial workplace is irreversible. This program portrays the peer pressures on the shop floor that might discourage workers from using protective devices - but at their peril. We see one factory worker who is teased about wearing his ear muffs, but his fantasies convince him that the consequences are worse than the flak he cops. A light-hearted drama which emphasises the necessity of using the correct protective gear at work. Stars Bryan Brown.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karl McPhee, Tom Manefield, Dept of Science and Technology and Film Australia

results.title: [Musterrolle: a compilation of short films by Peter Tscherkassky]
results.brief_description: 15 titles create this retrospective of experimental shorts by Austrian filmmaker Peter Tscherkassky. Titles date from 1981 through to the 1999 trailer for the Viennese Film Festival - Viennale. The films work through an experimentation with dissolves, double exposures, the ambiguity of light, found footage and the looping of vision and sound. Sound features heavily in Tscherkassky’s work and the principal composer here is Armin Schminkl. Schminkl also features as a subject for several films in the retrospective. Titles are as follows: Outerspace; The Arrival (L’Arrivee); Happy End; Parallel Space: interview; Tabula Rasa; Shot-Countershot; Kelimba; Manufraktur; Motion Picture; Urlaubsfilm; Freeze Frame; Liebesfilm; Erotique; Aderlab; Get Ready - Viennale ‘99 Trailer.
